book_name: CAE Oxford Human Performance and Limitations
chapter_title: The Nervous System, Ear, Hearing and Balance

questions.question: The outer, middle and inner ear are filled with:
What is the purpose of the Eustachian tube?
options: a. To pass sound waves across the middle ear to the auditory nerve
b. To allow ambient pressure to equalize on both sides of the ear drum
c. To allow ambient pressure to equalize on the middle ear side of the ear drum
d. To allow ambient pressure to equalize on both sides of the vestibular apparatus

questions.question: What causes conductive deafness?
options: a. Damage to the outer ear
c. Damage to the ossicles or the eardrum
d. Damage to the middle ear

questions.question: What is noise induced hearing loss (NIHL)?
options: a. Loss of hearing due to damage to the ossicles
b. Loss of hearing due to damage to the vestibular apparatus
c. Loss of hearing due to damage to the middle ear
d. Loss of hearing due to damage to the cochlea

questions.question: On what does NIHL depend?
options: a. Both the intensity and duration of the noise above 100 dB
b. The duration of the noise above 100 dB
c. The duration of the noise above 110 dB
d. Both the intensity and duration of the noise above 90 dB

questions.question: What is the most important sense for spatial orientation?
options: d. All senses play their part in situation awareness

questions.question: If an aircraft accelerates, what do the otoliths indicate to the brain?
options: a. That the aircraft nose is pitching down; this feeling will be reinforced by an air driven artificial horizon
b. That the aircraft is turning; this feeling will be reinforced by an air driven artificial horizon
c. That the aircraft is climbing and turning; this feeling will be reinforced by an air driven artificial horizon
d. That the aircraft is pitching up; this feeling will be reinforced by an air driven artificial horizon

questions.question: When can a pilot experience the "leans"?
options: d. In the climb or the descent

questions.question: Which part of the ear senses linear accelerations and decelerations?
options: a. The ossicles in the middle ear
b. The otoliths in the middle ear
c. The ossicles in the middle ear
d. The otoliths in the saccules canals

questions.question: What should a pilot rely on if disorientated in IMC?
options: b. Turning head to recover from disorientation

questions.question: The conductive system consists of:
options: a. the ear drum and ossicles
b. the semicircular canals and otoliths
c. the cochlea and eustachian tube
d. the cochlea and the mitus

questions.question: The frequency band that a healthy young person can hear is:
Decibels increase:
options: b. in terms of a logarithm

questions.question: Presbycusis is an impairment of hearing due to:
options: b. damage to the semicircular canals
